float32.name: bounding radius
float32.description: world units

float32.name: acceleration scale
float32.description: marine 1.0, grunt 1.4, elite 0.9, hunter 0.5, etc.

float32.name: render bounding radius
float32.description: if set, this radius is used to determine if the object is visible. set it for the pelican.

bit.name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

float32.name: period
float32.description: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

enum16.name: scale period by#multiply this function by the above period
scale function by#multiply this function by the result of the above function
wobble function#the curve used for the wobble

float32.name: wobble period
float32.description: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

float32.name: wobble magnitude
float32.description: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

float32.name: square wave threshold
float32.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

int16.name: step count
int16.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

int16.name: sawtooth count
int16.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

enum16.name: add#add this function to the final result of all of the above math
scale result by#multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math
bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used

int16.name: turn off with
int16.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function index

float32.name: scale by
float32.description: applied before clip, ignored if zero

bit.name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

plugin.comment: This sets which string from tags\ui\hud\hud_item_messages.unicode_string_list to display.

float32.name: detonation delay
float32.description: seconds min

float32.name: detonation delay
float32.description: seconds max

plugin.comment: All weapons should have 'primary trigger' and 'secondary trigger' markers as appropriate. Blurred permutations are called '$primary-blur' and '$secondary-blur'.

bit.name: (OBSOLETE)does not depower active camo in multilplayer

ascii.name: label
ascii.description: the string used to match this weapon to an animation mode in the unit carrying it

int16.name: maximum alternate shots loaded
int16.description: if the second trigger loads alternate ammunition, this is the maximum number of shots that can be loaded at a time

float32.name: heat recovery threshold
float32.description: the heat value a weapon must return to before leaving the overheated state, once it has become overheated in the first place

float32.name: overheated threshold
float32.description: the heat value over which a weapon first becomes overheated (should be greater than the heat recovery threshold)

float32.name: heat detonation threshold
float32.description: the heat value above which the weapon has a chance of exploding each time it is fired

float32.name: heat detonation fraction
float32.description: the percent chance (between 0.0 and 1.0) the weapon will explode when fired over the heat detonation threshold

float32.name: heat loss per second
float32.description: the amount of heat lost each second when the weapon is not being fired

float32.name: heat illumination
float32.description: the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is overheated

plugin.comment: an optional actor variant that specifies the burst geometry and firing patterns to be used with this weapon

float32.name: near reticle range
float32.description: the range at which the closer of the two static target reticles will be drawn

float32.name: far reticle range
float32.description: the range at which the farther of the two static target reticles will be drawn

float32.name: intersection reticle range
float32.description: the maximum range at which the dynamic target reticle will be drawn

int16.name: magnification levels
int16.description: the number of magnification levels this weapon allows

degree.name: autoaim angle
degree.description: the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

float32.name: autoaim range
float32.description: the maximum distance that autoaim works at full strength

degree.name: magnetism angle
degree.description: the maximum angle that magnetism works at full strength

float32.name: magnetism range
float32.description: the maximum distance that magnetism works at full strength

degree.name: deviation angle
degree.description: the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel

float32.name: forward movement penalty
float32.description: percent slowdown to forward movement for units carrying this weapon

float32.name: sideways movement penalty
float32.description: percent slowdown to sideways and backward movement for units carrying this weapon

float32.name: minimum target range
float32.description: minimum range that actors using this weapon will try and target stuff at

float32.name: looking time modifier
float32.description: how much faster actors look around idly using this weapon (zero is unchanged)

float32.name: age heat recovery penalty
float32.description: how much the weapon's heat recovery is penalized as it ages

float32.name: age rate of fire penalty
float32.description: how much the weapon's rate of fire is penalized as it ages

float32.name: age misfire start
float32.description: the age threshold when the weapon begins to misfire

float32.name: age misfire chance
float32.description: at age 1.0, the misfire chance per shot

float32.name: active camo ding
float32.description: how much to decrease active camo when a round is fired

float32.name: active camo regrowth rate
float32.description: how fast to increase active camo (per tick) when a round is fired

float32.name: reload time
float32.description: the length of time it takes to load a single magazine into the weapon

float32.name: chamber time
float32.description: the length of time it takes to chamber the next round

bit.name: tracks fired projectile#poo poo ca ca pee pee
random firing effects#rather than being chosen sequentially, firing effects are picked randomly
can fire with partial ammo#allows a weapon to be fired as long as there is a non-zero amount of ammunition loaded
does not repeat automatically#once fired, this trigger must be released and pressed to fire again
locks in on/off state#once depressed, this trigger must be released and pressed again to turn it off (and likewise to turn it back on)
projectiles use weapon origin#instead of coming out of the magic first person camera origin, the projectiles for this weapon actually come out of the gun
sticks when dropped#if this trigger is pressed when its owner drops the weapon (for whatever reason) this trigger stays down
ejects during chamber#this trigger's ejection port is started during the key frame of its chamber animation
projectile vector cannot be adjusted#projectiles fired by this weapon cannot have their direction adjusted by the AI to hit the target

float32.name: rounds per second
float32.description: the number of firing effects created per second min

float32.name: rounds per second
float32.description: the number of firing effects created per second max

float32.name: acceleration time
float32.description: the continuous firing time it takes for the weapon to achieve its final rounds per second

float32.name: deceleration time
float32.description: the continuous idle time it takes for the weapon to return from its final rounds per second to its initial

float32.name: blurred rate of fire
float32.description: a percentage between 0 and 1 which controls how soon in its firing animation the weapon blurs

int16.name: magazine
int16.description: the magazine from which this trigger draws its ammunition index

int16.name: rounds per shot
int16.description: the number of rounds expended to create a single firing effect

int16.name: minimum rounds loaded
int16.description: the minimum number of rounds necessary to fire the weapon

int16.name: rounds between tracers
int16.description: the number of non-tracer rounds fired between tracers

enum16.name: firing noise#how loud this weapon appears to the AI

float32.name: error
float32.description: the accuracy (between 0.0 and 1.0) of the weapon during firing min

float32.name: error
float32.description: the accuracy (between 0.0 and 1.0) of the weapon during firing max

float32.name: acceleration time
float32.description: the continuous firing time it takes for the weapon to achieve its final error

float32.name: deceleration time
float32.description: the continuous idle time it takes for the weapon to return to its initial error

float32.name: charging time
float32.description: the amount of time it takes for this trigger to become fully charged

float32.name: charged time
float32.description: the amount of time this trigger can be charged before becoming overcharged

float32.name: charged illumination
float32.description: the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is fully charged

float32.name: spew time
float32.description: length of time the weapon will spew (fire continuously) while discharging

tagRef.name: charging effect
tagRef.description: the charging effect is created once when the trigger begins to charge

float32.name: first person offset
float32.description: +x is forward, +z is up, +y is left x

float32.name: first person offset
float32.description: +x is forward, +z is up, +y is left y

float32.name: first person offset
float32.description: +x is forward, +z is up, +y is left z

float32.name: ejection port recovery time
float32.description: the amount of time (in seconds) it takes for the ejection port to transition from 1.0 (open) to 0.0 (closed) after a shot has been fired

float32.name: illumination recovery time
float32.description: the amount of time (in seconds) it takes the illumination function to transition from 1.0 (bright) to 0.0 (dark) after a shot has been fired

float32.name: heat generated per round
float32.description: the amount of heat generated each time the trigger is fired

float32.name: age generated per round
float32.description: the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired

float32.name: overload time
float32.description: the next trigger fires this often while holding down this trigger

reflexive.name: firing effects
reflexive.description: firing effects determine what happens when this trigger is fired

int16.name: shot count lower bound
int16.description: the minimum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

int16.name: shot count upper bound
int16.description: the maximum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

tagRef.name: firing effect
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: misfire effect
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: empty effect
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagRef.name: firing damage
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: misfire damage
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: empty damage
tagRef.description: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded
